reviews.review: This game is awesome. I recommend getting this because not only that it's a zombie game, but also because it has a feel to the game. The game doens't require high graphics card and it can handle mine fine. The game has a challenge to it and it gets pretty intense at some parts. The game has a slow mo to it so whenever the game goes to slow motion, you have time to get headshots and money. Overall, this game is fun and you should consider getting it for the price. Right now it's on sale.

The horde modes are very customizable so you can learn the game by starting very easy and progressively harder as you gain more perks and skill. Good for whenever you just want to kill something.

Mann vs machine gameplay with L4D2 gore, and all the characters are British!  Quite fun but you need friends to play it with.

Extremely fun game, especially with friends.

Specifications
Easy game to run, and very easy to optimize. May have long load times,however, but fixes exist.

Gameplay
Interesting, Squad-based gameplay. Every perk requires a fitting strategy. 

Community
Most people are nice, but there are those annoying people who can ruin a game. In higher difficulty, one person being stupid can wipe a group.

Difficulty
The game has many difficulty settings, some of which are truly difficult.

DLC/Extensions
There are mods, but the community is not too large. DLC is extremely overpriced (to get just the weapon pack dlc, which adds NEW WEAPONS(not reskins), you need to pay more than the original game.)

It's a good game, but the overpricing of DLC truly does ruin it. A DLC pack should not include weapons that can aid in gameplay, especially if it takes more than the original game to get it.  Some people in the community are terrible too.

Knitting Flour is a sexually charged satire about the consumeristic society of modern day England. In a total heel move, Kneading Fleece actually rewards newer players who have just bought the game as opposed to helping those who have purchased it previously by giving them all sorts of tasty treats to munch on while skateboarding off of each others dicks, leaving the veterans to cower and shrivel in the corner with nothing but their measley base skins and XP while the playground bully known as DLC pokes them with a rather large stick and tries to pressure them into spending their hard earned cash on some of his "services". The gameplay in Karate Flop consists of you and 5 other losers who in yet another cunning move by Tripwire Interactive are all voiced by the same British man (if you chose to give into peer pressure earlier on and got into Mister DLC's unmarked white van you can receive an additional 2 voice actors) to really send home the impression that society has decayed into a bunch of greedy identical sheep. It's pretty much a dude shooter, with some dudes being bigger and having more lights strapped to them then other dudes, and festivities happen around the holiday times, ya know in case you don't have any friends or family and your one outlet for communication and celebration is your computer, you pathetic fuck. TL;DR It's aight

The floor doesn't actually kill you 0/10
Get this game

It's the Zombie Apocolypse. Okay technically it's mutants but they're pretty much zombies.

You are British.

And you have a gun.


There's been a lot of games like this. Shoot the "zombies" while in a group. Killing Floor is one of the better implementations, and kind of uses zombies in a game well. It's a fad, and it has been for awhile, and it's really overdone. But it's not entirely without reason. 

Killing Floor can get away with a lot because it's deliberately tongue in cheek. Your character makes sarcastic remarks, and there's a sassy merchant who uses a lot of innuendo. My take on it is that she's not actually interested in you that way, and at some level she is trying to get you to buy her wares... but she does seem like a pretty nice arms merchant. And it's important to keep a good attitude during the Zombie Apocolypse. Especially if there's a bunch of big scary well armed men. That you just sold the arms to....

And you may be giving ideas...

Gameplay has you picking from one of several roles, such as snipers (Is that infected big and scary? Take them out from far away), pyros (clear out groups. With fire), medics, and so on. Coordination is important. And it's essential in harder difficulties (I can't tackle those for one!)

Good sarcastic fun. And the community doesn't seem toxic which is a real feature with first person shooters.
This game will keep you hooked for a long time! There is a lot of things to do and is very fun with friends. 8.5/10

Alright I'm going to start out by saying that playing this game on your own really desn't give you the full experience. It lets you, but there really isn't any fun in it. The fun is in working along side friends, or even new players, to survive hordes of terrifying zombies.

Now that that's out of the way, I absolutely reccomend this game to just about everyone who isn't sick of, or scared shitless by, zombie survival games. The gunplay is solid, I have noticed next to no glicthes, and in the later waves, things can really get hectic.

In game you select a perk (to be gone over later). Once the game begins and you complete the first wave, you are directed to a shop that has opened up somewhere on the map to by weapons, armor, and ammo with cash earned from killing zeds.

While there are DLC weapon packs available, you by no means HAVE to buy them ,as some are simply golden reskins of other weapons. Those that aren't, while adding interesting new weapons, by no means unbalance the game. The skin packs that are available make no changes to gameplay, as your character model doesn't change your stats.

Speaking of stats. There are multiple classes to chose from in the game, including: Commando, Marksman, FIrebug, Demolitionist, Support Specialist, Medic, and berserker. Every class can use every type of weapon, but each class also gets specific discounts on a TYPE of weapon, a well as boosts related to that waepon type. Aslo, you can level up all of your perks, no matter which one you are using in a game. For example if you are a medic, but you blow a lot of zeds up with grenades, that grenade damage will progress you demolitionist class. A rundown of each of these follows.

Commando: This is your basic run and gun class. You get a discout on assault/battle rifles, and damange, accuracy, and reload speed bounses along side. The final class perk is the ability to reveal the invisible zeds at a  certain distance away from you. While this can be helpful, those zeds are normally easy to detect on their own. To rank up your commando perk, you must kill zeds with assault rifles, as well as get a certain amount of kills against a specific type of zed, the invisible ones. Overall this class is good if you like assault rifles, but I'm not really sure it's specialty skill is all that useful.

Marksman: For the sniper in you. This class focuses on the use of high powered, accuracy based weapons. You get a discount on all sniper/DMR rifles, a bouns to reload speed, kickback, damange, and headshot damage to all of those weapons. Do NOT get this class confused as a "camper" class, because in this game, you CANNOT camp on your own, and even with your friends it isn't reccomended.

Firebug: BURN BABY BURN! This class is based on flame weapons. you get a discount on all fire based weapons, increasded damage with them, as well as HUGE resistance to fire damage. That's all there is to say about this. (also, it goes great with the TF2 pyro skin that is unlocked by default...)

Demolitionist: KABOOM BABY! Simple, you get explosives, and you blow stuff up. This class recieves a discount on grenades, explosives weapons, as well as the ability to carry multiple sets of pipe bombs for setting traps. there is also the bonus to explosive damage, and explosives resistance.

Support specialist: This class likes their shotguns. You recieve a discount on shotguns, as well as bonus damage, accuracy, and reload speed. the special thing about this character is a boost to welding efficency. all characters come with welders for welding and unwelding doors. welded doors cannot be opened, hence becoming impassible, but they also must be broken down before any zeds can get through, making it a good way to seal off one entrance to a building, hence funneling zeds into your perfectly planned crossfire. The support speicalst is faster and welding and unwelding, and his welder recharges faster than any other class.

Medic: "If you aint dead, I'll keep you that way" This class is based on healing your allies. While every other class' grenade is based on a simple explosion, the medics grenade creates a green cloud AOE effect that damages zeds inside it, and heals your allies inside it. good for if your beserker is on the front lines. You also recieve a HUGE discount on medic guns (which is good, because those are the most expensive in the game). Medic guns allow you to fire healing darts at your allies from a distance. You also recieve bonus' to medic gun clip size, and damage. the other perks of this class include better body armor, healing recharge rate, and healing potentcy. Finally, resistance to damage dealt by the "bloat" special zed, which spits acid barf at you. (pleasant right?...)

Berserker: CHAAAAAARGE!!!!! This class if your melee class. you get discount on all melee weapons, and increased damage. you also gain immunity to being held in place by "clots" the basic zed, which normally would grab a hold of you and keep you in place.

There you have it, a rundown of each class, as well as basic thoughts on the game. so, Grab your friends, grab your guns, and get killin!

Killing Floor is not the prettiest game I've ever played, the animations are pretty awkward and the movement feels awfully slow, but it is without a doubt one of the best games I own. The satisfaction of mowing down dozens of mutants never gets old. The game is challenging without being punishing, and encourages teamwork without making the individual player useless on his own. Perks are useful, if a little slow to upgrade. I've only managed to max one of 6 classes, the others all being just over halfway complete. The guns are powerful, accurate, and great fun to shoot. The continuous support of the developer has kept this long running game fresh and fun with new levels and weapons. DLC is a little overpriced but not necessary to enjoy the full game. Overall I've sunk countless hours into this game and already recommend it to anyone who asks me about  it!

If you like shooters, or team survival games, then you probably already own this game. If not, get it. You won't be disappointed.
Far more fun that it should be.  Even after 100 hours, it is still enjoyable.
Just a fun zombie game to play with friends or strangers

Killing Floor es una experiencia interactiva que sigue la estela de títulos similares como Dear Esther, Proteus o To the Moon, llevando el género un paso más hacia delante. Erroneamente uno podría interpretar que lo de survival-horror cooperativo es un error de traducción, pero en realidad es una licencia poética de Tripwire Interactive.

Killing Floor es, ante todo, una feroz crítica al capitalismo salvaje que nos rodea, dejando a Karl Marx como un mero diletante: Una vez comenzada la partida, el jugador se verá envuelto en un entorno hostil plagado de mendigos pidiendo limosna y este se verá obligado a arrojar alegremente fajos de billetes por la calle, haciéndole creer que la caridad sirve para algo. Unas rondas más tarde, el jugador se dará cuenta de que su filantropía no basta para sobrevivir, debiendo colaborar con el movimiento obrero para hacer frente a los sucios liberales, culminando la partida con un encuentro con el mismísimo Milton Friedman renacido.

10/10
Killing Floor is always a good time. I've been playing it on and off for about two years and the basic gunplay is simple but fun. It just never gets old popping zombies heads off, does it?

Fantastic zombie slaughtering game.
I enjoy the events and non stop action.

An amazing survival game overall. It combines great gameplay (classes, levelling up said classes, wave-based really intense combat) with some fun thanks to the British voices and overall silliness.
You can really have a lot of fun in this game thanks to it having a lot of maps (and you can get even more with the workshop!), the ability to play them with different classes gives a different feel, the different difficulties as well. Honestly this is just the kind of game you can put 1000 hours in and still feel like playing it, the class-leveling system contributes to this a lot because you'll always want to get that damn level even though it's going to take ages getting there.
You think you're done? Hell no, say hello to the halloween/christmas/summer/whatever-they-come-up-with update, because this game gets updated so often you'll always come back to it even if you left it alone for a while.
In short, BUY IT.

I love zombie / apacolypse survival games. Killing floor is no different. Multiplayer and servers can be tricky to set up, but Killing Floor is worth it. Awesome class / character progression system to fit multiplayer or singleplayer roles. Several different zombie types keep the game interesting. There's also a wide variety of unlockable guns and DLC guns for each class.I'm also a big fan of welding doors shut to temporarily hold off the impending doom. The difficulty levels are great in case the game gets too easy (or hard). I definetly recommend this game if you like survival / apocalypse shooters.
